verses.roman:
ṛṣabha-parvate cali' āilā gaurahari
nārāyaṇa dekhilā tāṅhā nati-stuti kari'

synonyms: ṛṣabha-parvate—to the Ṛṣabha Hill; cali'-walking; āilā—arrived; gaurahari—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; nārāyaṇa—the Deity of Lord Nārāyaṇa; dekhilā—saw; tāṅhā—there; nati-stuti kari'-offering obeisances and prayers.
translation: When the Lord arrived at Ṛṣabha Hill, He saw the temple of Lord Nārāyaṇa and offered obeisances and various prayers.

purport.content: Ṛṣabha Hill is in southern Karṇāṭa, in the district of Madurai. Twelve miles north of Madurai City is a place called Ānāgaḍa-malaya-parvata, which is situated within the forest of Kuṭakācala. Within this forest Lord Ṛṣabhadeva burned Himself to ashes. Now this place is known as Palni Hill.
